events.name: Global Day of CodeRetreat 2015 - Singapore
events.description: Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time. Host: CJ from PayPalFacilitator: • Abhaya from Neo • Tim Oxley from NodeSource • Gordon Song from ThoughtWorks Please RSVP at DevFest.asia
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore

events.name: Making things Move
events.description: Make things that twist, turn, pop and move. Parents and children can get hands on together and learn tinkering skills, science and art in this fun workshop.

events.name: Particles Matter: An Exploration of Collaborative Practices
events.description:
Particles Matter: An Exploration of Collaborative Practices
Saturday 14 Nov
2pm - 6pm
Expression Gallery, L4
FREE

This Conversations we explore the world’s greatest experiment with Dr Harry Cliff, Co-Curator of Collider with London Science Museum and Particle Physicist. National University of Singapore Associate Professor Chan Aik Hui will share his experiences from CERN as we link up live to the control room of the ATLAS Experiment at CERNcollider and we will hear a recital from Singapore playwright Eleanor Wong who has recently completed a residency with Centre for Quantum Technologies.We finish the day with a discussion between INFN LNF - Laboratori Nazionali di Frascati's Vincenzo Napolano and Paolo Soppola from embrio.net collective about their collaboration on the installation, ‘The Gift of Mass’.

Programme 
2.00pm: Welcome by Honor Harger, Executive Director of ArtScience Museum
2.10pm: Dr Harry Cliff, Fellow of Modern Science at Science Museum in London and curator of Collider
2.40pm: Professor Phil Chan Aik Hui, Associate Professor, NUS Department of Physics
3.10pm: LIVE link up with CERN
3.25pm: Q&A
3.35pm: Break
3.50pm: Welcome back by Honor Harger and introduction to the body of work done in the field of ArtScience.
4.00pm: Introduction by Jenny Hogan, Centre for Quantum Technologies at NUS
4.10pm: Eleanor Wong, playwright and poet.
4.25pm: Session with Vincenzo Napolano, Italian Nuclear Physic Institute and Paolo Scoppola, embrio.net collective, moderated by Dr Laura Longo, Associate Professor, NTU School of Art, Design and Media
5.00pm: Q&A 
5.15pm: Event Ends

events.name: Become a mentor for NodeSchool Singapore IV
events.description: We need mentors for the upcoming NodeSchool Singapore IV. If you have some real node/js experience and would like to become a mentor for the Sunday NodeSchool session, we are going to run a mini-NodeSchool at our place the day prior to level up some developers into mentors.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore
